PartyCertifiedCapacity.name: PartyCertifiedCapacity
PartyCertifiedCapacity.description: Represents the information captured from the certificate of capacity, such as the party's capacity to work, a timeline for recovery, and return to work.

Capacity.description: The percentage of capacity the party is able to work.

ClaimId.description: The Claim associated with the Party Certified Capacity.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: If multiple currencies are enabled, this field contains the currency ISO code associated with the record.

EffectiveEndDate.description: The end date of the period the certificate is effective for.

EffectiveStartDate.description: The start date of the period the certificate is effective for.

ExpectedWorkReturnDate.description: The expected date the party returns to work.

FullCapacityFromDate.description: The date the party has the full capacity to work.

IssueDate.description: The date the certificate was issued.

IssuerId.description: The Issuer of the Party Certified Capacity.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view.

Name.description: Name of the party certified capacity.

NoCapacityEndDate.description: The end date of the certified period in which the party has no capacity to work.

NoCapacityStartDate.description: The start date of the certified period in which the party has no capacity to work.

OwnerId.description: The Owner associated with the Party Certified Capacity.

PartialCapacityEndDate.description: The end date of the certified period in which the party has some capacity to work.

PartialCapacityStartDate.description: The start date of the certified period in which the party has some capacity to work.

PartyId.description: The Party associated with the Party Certified Capacity.

Status.description: Specifies the status of the certificate.

UsageType.description: Internal field. Specifies the application using the entity to populate data.
